characters: INT PALACE COURTYARD / GREAT HALL AFTERNOON 37

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I am ready for the Russian ambassador.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Who did your make up?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: We went for something dramatic. Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You look like a badger.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Oh. Her eyes start to tear.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're going to cry? Really? She stops her. They look in a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think you look like?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: (sadly) A badger. Sarah smiles ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And do you really think you can meet the Russian delegation looking like that? She shakes her head. SARAH (CONT’D) I will manage it. Go back to your rooms. She nods sadly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Sarah walks off. Anne walks back toward the Footman (3). looks straight ahead.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 10.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you just look at me! Did you?! He shakes his head no. Looks at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do not avert your eyes! Shut them! He shuts them. She goes back into her rooms.

dialogues.speaker: INT KITCHEN DAY 16
dialogues.text: The busy, bustling kitchen. Maids scurry. Cooks cook. In a corner piles of Dishes and dirty caked on plates in front of her. Steaming hot water in troughs. Abigail work the dishes. Sally comes in carrying a bucket and brush.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (bright and friendly) Oh hello. I was thinking of playing cards later if you would like to join me.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Sounds brill. The old bag says you are to scrub the floor until she can see her toothless fat face in it. She hands her the bucket full of liquid.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. Abigail shrugs. Gets down on her hands and knees. She plu her hand in the bucket. Intense pain shoots through her h She pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You might need gloves. Lye is dangerous. It burns bad. Abigail writhes in pain. The girls laugh and saunter off she sticks her burning hand into a sink of cold water. i7 INT KITCHEN NIGHT i7 The kitchen is quiet. A few servants work but it’s late. Abigail works her way through the dishes in the near empt kitchen, the red raw pain in her hand excruciating. Mrs M rushes in. Sees Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: MRS MEG
dialogues.text: (to Abigail) You! Get the bandage box! Abigail looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: MRS MEG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hurry! The Queen’s had an attack of gout. Mrs Meg grabs a bucket covered with a white cloth. Abigail retrieves the bandage box.

dialogues.speaker: INT BACKSTAIRS / WWS NIGHT 18
dialogues.text: Abigail follows Mrs Meg along a narrow corridor. Abigail juggles the bandage box and bucket.

dialogues.speaker: INT GOLDEN HALLWAY NIGHT 19
dialogues.text: They pass Footman (1). The doors open.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS NIGHT 20
dialogues.text: Abigail looks around as she enters the Queen’s rooms for first time. Piercing sobs draw Abigail’s attention. They enter the se darkened bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS NIGHT 21
dialogues.text: Anne is lying on the floor, her leg raised up on a chair. Sarah is there, examining Anne’s foot. Anne screams. Foot 1 brings a bottle of brandy past hurriedly. The QUEEN’S M stands by as the QUEEN’S DOCTOR examines her leg. Mrs. Meg motions to her, Abigail puts the bucket down. Sarah glances briefly at Abigail, The Doctor, who is layi leech on Anne’s leg. She flinches.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Sarah!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m here. I’m here. Brandy! She pushes a shot of brandy to Anne’s trembling lips. Abigail watches on.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: They hurt.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I know my dearest I know. The beef! Mrs Meg uncovers the bucket to reveal thin slices of raw beef. Abigail starts laying the slices on her leg. Anne screams. SARAH (CONT’D) Gently cousin. Abigail nods. The Queen focuses on Abigail for a second, a new wave of pain comes on her. Anne closes her eyes grimacing.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Anne) It's alright. Tell me a story. (to Mrs Meg and the Doctor) You two may go. (to Abigail) You, start wrapping that. Mrs Meg and the Doctor nod and exit. Abigail wraps the le bandages. Anne, Sarah and Abigail are left there. But to Sarah it’s just her and Anne.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I... can’t. I...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How we first met. Tell me that. Come on. Anne struggles to focus, but tries.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: The... wretched... Cheever boy had me down on the ground and was holding me... dropping spittle in my face.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He is still a pig. Then what? Blood leaks through some pores. She mops it up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I heard footsteps, fast footsteps, and saw these pink shoes running towards me...

dialogues.speaker: THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17
dialogues.text: Anne gulps brandy down. She is calming.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 13.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: +. and then they disappeared and I heard a crack. And then he fell off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: me, and I looked over and... ughh.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Remember how his jaw just hung there?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I do. You took my hand and said ‘Hello, I’m Sarah. You're covered in spittle. Let’s wash you off’. They laugh. Abigail is awkward at being present to this private moment.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You must try to sleep. Anne nods. She clasps Sarah’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Abigail) You may go. She goes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Don’t leave.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I won't. Anne closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Are you still there?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yes. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: still?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yes. Sarah touches Anne’s face, tenderly. 22 INT SERVANTS’ QUARTERS NIGHT 22 It's dark and cramped. Abigail is lying huddled in the corner. She raises her hand and unwraps the bandage to se it, blistered and sore.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 14. She looks around at the sleeping, farting, snoring bodies She can’t bear it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT STABLES DAWN 23
dialogues.text: Pre dawn. Abigail passes a sleeping groom by the stable d

dialogues.speaker: EXT PARK MORNING 24
dialogues.text: A forested area. Abigail, one hand on the reins, races through the dawn light. She comes to a halt, breathless and happy for a moment. S dismounts the horse and scans the forest floor for a particular plant. Upon finding it, she breaks off some leaves. She crushes the leaves with a stone on another st and then unbandages her hand, places the pulp against her blisters and redresses her hand. She reaches down and bun together some more leaves before getting back on her hors Through the trees, she spies a handsome Equerry in his twenties, MASHAM. His eyes are closed and his head rests his horse's neck. He looks peaceful. Abigail watches him, transfixed. Suddenly his eyes blink open and he looks straight at her. She kicks her horse and shoots away.

dialogues.speaker: INT BACKSTAIRS / WWS / A
dialogues.text: Abigail walks up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 26
dialogues.text: Abigail walks into the apartment. She sees the Footman 1 the night before guarding the door.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: For the Queen. The doctor has ordered it immediately. It is a matter of extreme urgency

dialogues.speaker: FOOTMAN 1
dialogues.text: She's sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Shall I tell the doctor you imperiled the Queens health and let you rue the ramifications.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTMAN 1
dialogues.text: What does ramifi...mean.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It means he will have you whipped. He nods, waves a hand to let her through. She goes into t Queen's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 27
dialogues.text: Anne lies sleeping, snoring slightly. Abigail examines he legs. They are still inflamed. She removes the dressing, pulls out the leaves she found on her ride and places the gently on her legs. Anne stirs a little. Sarah enters. Stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I am... I... these are peleatis, the herb. I cut them this morning. They remove swelling and inflammation. I saw them and I thought it may help the Queen.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You cannot just walk in here! why did the footman let you through?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I lied to him. It is not his fault. I just wanted to help her. She seemed to suffer so much. Sarah sees a group of three military men, Godolphin and Marlborough enter at the far door. She nods to them.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Footman take her downstairs. Tell Mrs. Meg she is to receive six of the birch. Go! Abigail is stunned. She nods and walks with the footman 1 past the entering men. Sarah goes to the woozy Anne.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You must focus Anne. Much is at stake.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 28
dialogues.text: The maps are laid out across Anne’s legs, she struggles t focus. Marlborough has a pointer. He hits the map.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 16.

dialogues.speaker: MARLBOROUGH
dialogues.text: We gather forces here. The Austrians mass here. Anne focuses on the map.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Is that... which country again?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Listen! She hits the map with the pointer.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marlborough.

dialogues.speaker: MARLBOROUGH
dialogues.text: This is the town of Lille, in a valley. We lure them in by sending a small force to engage them. They give chase. We descend in numbers from above them.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Hear hear. Others concur.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It is a brilliant plan. Queen Anne, you agree?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: The people expect it to be over. Sarah takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We all want it over, but wishing does not make it so Anne. We could sue for peace, but we will not get it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: It does help. They turn. Anne stirs. She sits up woozy, as if slightly drugged.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Something soothing on my legs, it takes the burn out. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh. Herbs. Of some sort.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 17. 29

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: It's nice. Thank you. She closes her eyes. Falls asleep. They stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: INT KITCHEN DAY 29
dialogues.text: The Footman 1 drags a struggling Abigail in, holding her her ear. The whole kitchen stops. Servants turn and watch

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: No! Please! He takes her to a side bench by the wall. Pushes her over

dialogues.speaker: MRS MEG
dialogues.text: Do her in the barn if that is what is, not in my kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTMAN ONE
dialogues.text: Her Ladyship says six of the birch for this one. Mrs Meg shrugs and nods. He pulls down the back of Abigail’s dress to reveal her b back. Mrs Meg goes to the corner and gets a hard stick of birch The other girls stand around eating biscuits, excited for show. Abigail focuses on a smiling Sally. Mrs Meg lifts her arm and lashes the birch across her bac Abigail flinches.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: She really is a lady, look how soft that skin is. Mrs Meg pulls her arm back, strikes her again.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH OS
dialogues.text: Stop! Sarah enters.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH OS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let her up. Abigail stands. A welt starts forming across her back.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 18.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: INT KITCHEN HALLWAY DAY 30
dialogues.text: Sarah and Abigail in a small hallway off the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So you are perhaps too kind for your own good.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It has been said.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Which leads to stupidity. But the Queen is soothed somewhat so I thank you. You shall get me more of those herbs. And not overstep again.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Yes Maam. My father always spoke highly of you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I liked your father, he had charm to burn. And then I guess he did. Abigail nods. SARAH (CONT’D) You have fallen far.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Yes. When I was fifteen my father lost me in a card game.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You are not serious? Abigail Oh he was very upset about it. Took off into the forest with nothing but a scullery maid and a dozen bottles for solace.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And you went?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: We honour our debts. They would have hurt him.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 19.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Foolish. A woman should not let herself be chattel.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I wanted to do right by my father. The debt was to a balloon shaped German man with a thin cock. Thankfully I managed to convince him a woman has her blood in twenty eight days a month. Sarah considers her, notices her bandage hand.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What happened to your hand?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Some of my colleagues are immune to my charms. 31 INT. ABIGAIL’S BEDROOM DAY 31 Mrs Meg opens a door. Abigail enters a cell like room containing a single bed, a small table and a wash basin. Abigail puts her battered bag on the floor. She can’t bel it. She is thrilled and bounces on the bed. Her own room. Mrs Meg leaves with a leer. Abigail goes and shuts the do and notices there is no lock.

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY / CG DAY 32
dialogues.text: Abigail, now dressed in a new dress, walks along the hall with Sarah. Sarah carries a document with the royal seal it. A chubby aristocrat, EARL STRATFORD, sees Sarah and h toward her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Earl Stratford, do not come near me whining today or I will crush your tiny heart to liver. He backs off. A French woman elegantly dressed, MADAME TOURNEE.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Madame Tournee. You may have the tapestry budget you have asked for. Spend one penny more and I will take your finger nails in lieu.

dialogues.speaker: MADAME TOURNEE
dialogues.text: Merci.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Abigail, get a platter of oysters sent to the Dutch Ambassador.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Yes your Ladyship. Masham steps into view.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Colonel Masham. He looks past Sarah and locks eyes with Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: Lady Marlborough.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The Queen will ride on Tuesday morning.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: Yes, Lady Marlborough. He loiters.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Would you like a bite of my new maid before you leave? He bows, a small smile exchanged between he and Abigail, departs. Sarah sees the smile between them.

dialogues.speaker: INT DRAWING ROOM DAY 33
dialogues.text: Godolphin and Harley sit on couches smoking. Horatio sits next to Godolphin.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Must the duck be here?

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Fastest duck in the city. Horatio is a prize worth stealing, he does not leave my side.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Keep him away from me or I will pull his liver out and eat it with a cornichon.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Charming.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: You should know, I have canvassed my party. They are waiting for us to announce an attempt at peace.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: We shall both make our case to the Queen. Harley stabs his pipe out, infuriated.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Where is the Queen? We have been waiting an hour. Sarah enters with Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Might I remind you, you are not the Queen.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: She has sent me to speak for her. She is unwell. Abigail goes to a side table set with cakes. She cutting a piece.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: What says she?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That Harley is a fop and a prat and smells like a ninety six year old French whore’s vajuju.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: I really doubt you’re quoting.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: She has decided to continue with the war. She feels another victory in will put us in a stronger position for a treaty. Her letters. She places a folded document with the royal seal table.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: And how are we to pay for this? Abigail delivers the cake.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The Land tax is to be doubled. starts on the 21.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: This is madness. The war you will be fighting will be in our own countryside.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: She relies on you and your love of England to hold the Tories together.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: There are limits.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: To love of your country? To me there is no limit on that. Our last farthing to protect England if we must.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: And our last man too? The dead pile up as do the resentments. Or that does not concern you?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I grieve them all, in my heart a scar for each, and I send my own beloved with them, chest bared. So do not lecture me on the cost. You do not count the cost in men until you need something heavy to toss on the scales with your greed.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: A treaty would save money and lives. A win for all Englishman.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: We go to them after one victory, they know we are scared. We bury more of them. They know we have them. The Queen has decided Harley.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: I disagree...a lot! I would like an audience with her where I may state my case.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: State it to me, I love a comedy. Is there cake? Harley stares at her, disbelievingly.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: This is a disgusting distortion of the system. You have no place in this!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Your mascara is running. If you'd like to go fix yourself we can continue this later. Harley kicks a small table across the room. He is exasperated, spittle flying. Abigail is thrilled by the w thing.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You will need to pay for the repair of that. We have a war to finance. Every penny counts.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: (to Harley) Come on, old bean. One more victory. Otherwise they will use the time it takes for a treaty negotiation to regroup. Mark my words. Harley ignores him, just staring angrily at Sarah. Sudden Harley runs at Sarah, stopping just in front of her. She doesn’t flinch. His breath is ragged, she breathes calmly breaks and storms from the room. GODOLPHIN (CONT’D) Must you rub it in? A man’s dignity is the thing that holds him back from running amok.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Sometimes a lady likes to have fun. Godolphin eyes Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: We need to be careful Sarah. He is a useful ally and a dangerous enemy. Godolphin exits. A wide eyed Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You are... extraordinary. A woman like no other.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And you are astute and perspicacious. And perhaps something of a flatterer.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It is not flattery when it is fact. You are not scared of anyone.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: INT GOLDEN HALLWAY DAY 34
dialogues.text: Abigail walks the hallway. Sees Masham. She follows him f bit. He turns around suddenly and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: Are you following me? Abigail turns on her heel and walks back the way she came He follows.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said are you following me?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You seem to be following me, sir, as I am in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: That was you on the horse this morning.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I ama servant, where would I get a horse? Perhaps you dreamt of me?

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: Perhaps it was you and I should have you stripped and whipped.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I’m waiting. She stares at him challengingly. He smiles, but doesn’t m She suddenly breaks off and heads into the backstairs.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 25. Harley walks in from another room. Sees Masham.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Going to ride that one are we?

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: She does make my blood hot. She is Lady Marlborough’s new one.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Indeed. Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: INT SARAH'S QUARTERS DAY 36
dialogues.text: Sarah walks and finds Abigail looking at her books.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Borrow anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Thank you. And thank you for the job.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I have a thing for the weak. Marlborough comes to the door. Sarah turns and looks at h

dialogues.speaker: MARLBOROUGH
dialogues.text: It is time. She nods. Then rushes to Marlborough and embraces him, holding him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You must be safe. You must not be foolish and brave. Be smart and safe. I beg you.

dialogues.speaker: MARLBOROUGH
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Stay with me tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MARLBOROUGH
dialogues.text: I must sleep with my men. It is only right. She nods. He kisses her softly on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: INT PALACE COURTYARD / GREAT HALL AFTERNOON 37
dialogues.text: Anne and Sarah stand at the window looking down on A line HIGH RANKING military men on black horses. Marlborough ra a hand of farewell to them. Abigail stands by the door.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I had a dream that this very small Frenchman covered in blood, was carrying his head around feeding it brie. Anne pinches her hand. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: He is a great soldier. Sarah composes herself.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He will be fine. We will prevail.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Of course we will Mrs Freeman. Anne walks away toward the door. Abigail coughs loudly as she reaches her. Attracting a lo from Anne.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I am sorry Your Majesty. I think I caught a chill picking the herbs for your leg.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: That was you?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Abigail. Anne nods. Heads past her and out. Sarah watches the horses disappear. Turns around. Sees Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Let’s shoot something.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PALACE GROUNDS / EG AFTERNOON 38
dialogues.text: A large cage full of cooing pigeons. Inside it a PIGEON B waits for his cue.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH 0/S
dialogues.text: Throw!  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 27. He releases a pigeon and it flies through the air. A guns and it drops to the ground. Sarah smiles, satisfied. At her feet, a pile of dead bird The dogs retrieve the latest. She looks across at Abigail has a gun.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It's sad really. They are so pretty.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Learn to fly faster, pretty will not save you bird.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: ‘Throw! A bird is released, Abigail raises her weapon and misses

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're really doing damage to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: As long as you are aware I have a gun.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You fought hard for this war and your husband is at the front of it, his life at risk. How can you ... do that?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It is right. If we don’t do it they will gather force and be over here cutting us all into chops within the year. You are of a sweet disposition and have had some blows so desire safety and favour above all else.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: If he dies?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Did you not sacrifice your cunt to fatty German to save your father?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Yes.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 28.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: There’s always a price to pay. I am prepared to pay it. Throw! The bird flies, she shoots it down. Stares across at Abig

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just relax and aim. When it crosses your eye, pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Throw! Abigail lines up the shot, shoots and brings it down. She smiles weakly, pleased yet sad.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yes! Perfect! I will make a killer of you yet.

dialogues.speaker: INT GREAT HALL EVENING 39
dialogues.text: A pair of bandaged legs in gold sequined stockings. Anne wheeled into the ballroom by a Footman (4) on a brocaded throne chair with wheels. The ballroom is thronged with people. People bow as she enters. She greets them. The wheels are chocked with little wooden chocks. Harley makes a beeline for her.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Your Majesty. How lovely to see you. It seems you have allocated even more money into the abyss that is this fool's errand.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Oh. Yes. We... will win. Sarah is sure we will win.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: This landholders tax. You have no idea the fire storm of rage you have set loose in the countryside.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Really? They are angry? Sarah arrives.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Dearest Queen. Anne smiles at Sarah.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 29.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: How do you like the stockings?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Festive.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: I was just explaining to the Queen the mistake this tax is, and the war as well. We should sue for peace.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh Harley, you're such a bore. That is for parliament. A ball is for dancing and eating these venison and horseradish puffs. Have you tried these?

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: I am having trouble swallowing at the moment. Your Majesty-

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I would like to enjoy the music now.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Of course. Sarah winks at Harley. He walks away. The orchestra strik up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh I love this music. I must dance. Sarah leaves Anne and walks to the centre of the room. Sh stands scanning the crowd who naturally stop talking and her attention. She raises her hand and slowly moves it ov the crowd, finally stopping on Masham.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You. A small smattering of applause as he heads to her. The music begins. The dancing begins. A fast paced waltz. little bit idiosyncratic, legs fly. Anne is thrilled, watching their slick leg work and fast moves. Then she saddens at the sight of her useless balloon like legs lai out in front of her, a little new blood seeping through h sequined stockings.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Stop it. Stop! The music stops suddenly. Sarah looks at Anne.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 30.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I would like to go back to my room now!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What has happened?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Now! The Footman (3) starts to wheel her away. People are star Anne sees Harley.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: stop! Mr Harley, I agree I went too far with the tax for the war.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: We shall keep it as it was. Sarah's eyes blaze. Harley smiles and bows. Sarah takes o pushing from the footman.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: We are your servants my Queen.

dialogues.speaker: INT GOLDEN HALLWAY NIGHT 40
dialogues.text: Sarah wheels Anne along. When they are alone, Sarah spins the wheelchair around.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Anne, I’m sorry. Anne slaps her hard across the face.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's okay. Anne nods. They smile at each other. SARAH (CONT’D) Shall we go fast? She runs with the chair, Anne shrieks and squeals.

dialogues.speaker: INT SARAH'S QUARTERS NIGHT 41
dialogues.text: Abigail climbs the ladder to the bookshelf. She slides a in and pulls a new one out.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 31. Hears the door open. Sees Anne’s wheelchair whiz in and c into the wall. Sarah follows behind. Abigail freezes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Give me your finger. Sarah does so. Anne puts it in her mouth. Sucks it for a second then bites it hard. Abigail’s eyes widen. She watches as Anne releases her bite, grabs Sarah, pulls face to hers, kissing her hard and passionately on the mo Abigail almost falls off the ladder, but stays up. Hangs

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck me. Sarah nods. She wheels her through to the bedroom. Across the way, Abigail stands rigid on the ladder. She breathes out. Drops to the floor. Starts to creep out as quietly as possible.

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY / A
dialogues.text: Abigail clutching a book, in a daze starts to walk down t stairway. Harley suddenly stands before her.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Abigail isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Yes sir,...

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Stole a book I see. Why, one could be stripped and whipped for that.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: My mistress lent it to me.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Shall we go ask her?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: No! Harley is satisfied he has something over her.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Come and take the night air with me. She is a little scared but follows him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PALACE LAWNS / EG NIGHT 43
dialogues.text: Harley walks with Abigail across the lawn. The lights of castle behind them.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: So you once were a lady and now you are a nothing, a bit of scullery scraps. How very sad.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I am still the lady I was. In my heart.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: No doubt. It is important to make new friends is it not?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Yes. If that is what is actually happening here, and not veiled threats under the guise of civility. Harley laughs.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Am I to understand you are smart?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You want something. To fuck me?

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: I will leave that to my friend Masham, who is completely cuntstruck by you. So tell me about Lady Marlborough, Godolphin, the Queen. Anything going on? I love gossip. It’s a failing I know.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Lady Marlborough has been good to me, she has saved me. I will not breach her confidence.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Of course. You are in favour. But favour is a breeze that shifts direction all the time. Then in an instant you're back sleeping with a bunch of scabrous whores wondering whose finger’s in your arse. You cannot have too many friends in court. I need a friend Abigail, one with cute ears and wide eyes. I am often blind-sided by the distorted situation at court. As Leader of the Opposition I should not be. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I would merely like to know of any plans her Ladyship, Godolphin or the Queen may have.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I will not betray my mistress’s trust.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Oh look a wren. How cute. She looks to the trees. Harley trips her and she goes fac first into the stony path.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you alright? Let me help you up. He reaches down. She warily reaches out a hand and he pul her up a little.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thing is if you're not my friend. You are.. Then suddenly lets her go, she falls back down.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ++ by definition my enemy. Anyway, think on it. No pressure. Harley stalks off. Abigail sees the little wren, lying de on the ground beside the path.

dialogues.speaker: INT SARAH'S QUARTERS DAY 44
dialogues.text: Morning. Abigail pours hot chocolate into two cups on a t Anne lying on a sofa. And Sarah on a chair.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You will have to tell Harley you have changed your mind about the tax.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: can’t you do that?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I am not the Queen.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: .+.are the people really angry about the land tax?  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 34.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They'll be angrier when the French are sodomising their wives and planting their fields with garlic.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: The Tories must not be rode roughshod over though. And...more dead if we do it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It is painful to lose men, but we cannot be half hearted in this or they will see our weakness and take us and we will lose thousands more. We must be strong Anne. It hangs in the balance and the tipping point is courage. Abigail approaches with the hot chocolate. SARAH (CONT’D) None for the Queen.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You cannot have hot chocolate. Your stomach, the sugar inflames it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Abigail hand me the cup.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Do not. Abigail is frozen.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I do not know what tor...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Fine, give it to her, and then go get a bucket and a mop for the aftermath. Anne takes it, but does not drink it. Sits with it. Abiga exits.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Take me back. She gets in her chair. Sarah goes across and unlocks the panel to the secret passage.

dialogues.speaker: INT SECRET PASSAGE DAY
dialogues.text: Sarah wheels Anne.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You will pronounce the tax in parliament. I will set the date. Anne nods. They stop. Sarah unlocks the door. Shuts the door and heads back up the passage.

dialogues.speaker: MAR 17
dialogues.text: 45 Rolls Anne in. 46 A suit of armour. A shot is fired banging into it, an arm falls to the ground. At a distance Sarah and Abigail. Sarah reloads her pistol using the gun powder funnel.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I must tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Mr Harley came to me. He asked me to betray your confidences, about what goes on between you and the Queen and Godolphin.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I see. And what will you do?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I... am not going to! Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Not obviously. You may tell me of his approach to encourage my trust and still work both sides of the street.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (outraged) I am a person of honour even if my station is not. Even if I were to be the last one left in this wretched place, I would remain a lady! Sarah laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You are pretty when outraged. So my secrets are safe with you?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: All of them.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Even your biggest secret. Sarah looks up at Abigail, who smiles knowingly. She clos her gun.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Abigail. Sarah rises her gun. Shoots. Abigail falls. Sarah starts laughing. A terrified Abigail lies on the ground, checking herself wounds. Sarah's smiling face appears suddenly above her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you forget to load the pellet the gun fires, makes the sound, but releases no shot. It is a great jape do you agree?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Yes.. great.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Maybe we will think of some use for it one day. Sometimes it is hard to remember if you have loaded the pellet or not. I do fear confusion and accidents.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I’m sure people will be careful.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 47
dialogues.text: Anne drops lettuce leaves into the enclosure for her rabb She watches them for a moment. She’s bored.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 48
dialogues.text: Anne sits alone, a big cake with blue icing half eaten be her as she plays solitaire. She takes another piece of ca her lips blue from the icing. She feels ill suddenly. Mak noise. Lady in waiting is ready with a bucket, she rushes over w and Anne throws up into it.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 37. 49 50 51 Footman (2) enters with a mop. Lady in waiting dabs at he lips with a linen. Anne pushes her away.

dialogues.speaker: INT SECRET PASSAGE DAY 49
dialogues.text: Anne on a crutch limps along the passageway.

dialogues.speaker: INT SARAH'S QUARTERS DAY 50
dialogues.text: Anne enters but the apartment is empty.

dialogues.speaker: INT PRIVY PURSE OFFICE DAY 51
dialogues.text: A full office, crammed with people and activity. Sarah is maintaining order, just. Sarah is at the desk, entering figures in the ledger. Abigail in the background.

dialogues.speaker: MRS MEG
dialogues.text: Twelve guineas for beef. She is rewarded with a nod. Harley watches on, seated to right of Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Madame Tournee. Madame Tournee steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Winter Ball. Your expenses are out of control! Madame Tournee Madame is an artiste and art is like a cloud, it floats and gathers force as it must before it rains joy.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Let it rain at the cost of eight guineas instead of fifty.

dialogues.speaker: MADAME TOURNEE
dialogues.text: But... Sarah looks to her ledger, ignoring Madame Tournee.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Cream. Mrs Meg your cream bill is outrageous. Are you bathing in it to help your hemorrhoids?

dialogues.speaker: MRS MEG
dialogues.text: No your Ladyship.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 38. 52

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: May I examine?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Of course. Harley looks down the ledger. He nods reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Perfect Lady Marlborough. As always.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Shall we sign off? He nods. He signs the ledger. As does she. PAGE BOY 2, a young boy of fifteen, comes in and whispers Sarah. INT ANNE’S APARTMENTS DAY 52 Sarah enters to find Anne standing on a window sill. She leans out dangerously, the wind pulls at her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Aim for the flagstones. The lawn may break your fall.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You do not care!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Mrs Morley. Please. Sarah goes to her. Grabs her suddenly by the back of the and yanks her inside. She lands on her arse.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Ow! Just stay for a little while! No! Take the day off. I command it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Someone must run things! (plaintively) I am not food! You cannot just eat and eat! Anne grabs Sarah by the forearm and bites her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: (playfully) And yet you are tasty. And licks her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And salty. And if I grilled you, you would make a delightful meal.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You are... incorrigible. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine. I will come and play whist with you this afternoon. Anne smiles and claps her hands. Sarah, resigned, turns a leaves.

dialogues.speaker: INT PARLIAMENT AFTERNOON 53
dialogues.text: The Tories stomp their feet heavily drowning out Godolphi he tries to speak.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: The opposition asks us to be halfhearted in this war! We will not! We must wear our griefs for England is worth our all, and suffer we must to save her! Mr Harley control your rabble! Sarah watches on. Sarah scribbles down a note and hands i pageboy 2.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 54
dialogues.text: INT GOLDEN HALLWAY AFTERNOON 54a Abigail walks through into the Queen’s apartment. She moves past the two Footmen (1-3) into

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS AFTERNOON 55
dialogues.text: There stands a table, set up, cards at the ready. A bottl champagne and glasses. A low growling sound comes from the next room. The Queen stands at a table and is stretching her leg in a ballet m and growling in pain. Abigail watches the Queen from the salon doorway. Anne se someone coming.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: About time Mrs Freeman. This fucking leg! It is like a monster attacking me. Cut it off for me will you?  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 40.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I do not think so your Majesty. Anne turns and looks at Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Lady Marlborough sent me as I am an excellent Whist player and she has been unavoidably detained with the business of state, but will be here post haste.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: It's my state! I am the business of state. Did she actually send me her maid?!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: As I am standing here I am going to assume that’s rhetorical. Your Majesty I wasn’t always a maid. I am educated, speak French, Latin. My family fell on hard times. I am also her cousin.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Very fascinating, but you shall leave regardless and tell her to come. Abigail turns to leave, sees the rabbit enclosure.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Oh! They are gorgeous. Anne grimaces, watches her go to them.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: My babies. Let them out please. Abigail unlatches the door, it swings open and the rabbit hop out into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: How many are there?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Seventeen. It’s Hildebrand’s day today.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Which one is he? Anne points to the small, white rabbit.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 41. 56 57 58

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: That one. Shy, but stubborn.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: May 1? Anne nods. Abigail picks him up.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: He likes you. I lost some seventeen children. Some born as blood, some without breath, and some just briefly with me. Abigail's heart instantly goes out to her, tears pop from eyes taking Anne by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my dear. Then Anne cries.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Today is Hildebrand’s... day. The day, you lost him. Anne nods.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Each one that dies, something of you goes with them. Abigail takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you like to join me?

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS EVENING 57
dialogues.text: At the table, a battered and half torn apart birthday cak On the floor, the rabbits sit with the Queen and Abigail feed them handfuls of cake. INT ABIGAIL’S BEDROOM NIGHT 58 Abigail lies on her bed reading one of Sarah’s books. She finishes and closes it. Suddenly the door swings open. Sh startled. It’s Masham. Masham is wearing his Cavalry uniform: a velvet jacket li in satin, white ruffles on his shirt, breeches, red stock and black patent shoes with heels. Make up.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 42. Abigail calmly stays where she is.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: What an outfit.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: Why thank you. I thought it might be too much.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Have you come to seduce me or rape me?

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: I am a gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: So rape then.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: No. You are a... You have intrigued me.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: And you, me. I am intrigued by what you look like under this. Abigail gets up carefully examines his powdered face. She smudges his lipstick. Abigail whisks the wig off his head. She ruffles his hair Abigail puts the wig on her own head. She takes a wet clo and wipes away some of his make up.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are handsome. No wonder you cover it up. Women would swoon and nothing would get done.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: Who are you? No ordinary maid.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It could be said I have fallen far. Masham pulls her to him suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: It could be said I aim to catch you. She leans in to kiss him. Bites his lip suddenly. Breaks.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I might allow it. She pushes him in the chest playfully.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 43. 59 60

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now good night sir. He takes his wig back. Puts it back on his head awkwardly making her laugh. Bows and leaves. She falls back on the bed. Smiles wryly.

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY / WWS NIGHT 59
dialogues.text: Masham shuts the door behind him. Harley waits in the hallway, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Progress?

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: She bit me. And this wig is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: A man must look pretty.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: I’m not entirely sure she approves.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Try again in your own way old boy. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne sits, dressed in a fine linen body suit. Sarah bring a complex contraption, not dissimilar to a Medieval suit armour. It has leather straps, buckles, iron plate and a steel brace. Sarah attaches the leather straps first to o shoulder and then the other shoulder, passing the straps under, over, and across Anne’s upper body, pushing her to raise first one arm and then the other. Sarah squeezes Anne’s spare flesh to ensure the straps ar tightly fitted to her body. Anne ow. Sarah attaches a Breast Plate and Back Plate to the leath straps. Sarah rocks Anne back and forward as she fits eac plate to a web of smaller leather straps and tightens eac buckle, as if she were screwing Anne into an iron cage. Sarah moves down to Anne’s bandaged leg. Sarah eases the leg into a steel brace which she tightens with screws.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 44. 61 62 The leg brace attaches to a seat that in turn attaches to iron and steel cage around Anne’s torso. Sarah steps back Nods.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PARK DAY 61
dialogues.text: Anne and Sarah ride on horseback down a wide avenue in th park. Anne packed into her contraption.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Apologies regarding sending Abigail in my stead.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: She was perfectly darling. Hildebrand really took to her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Is that a rabbit? Anne looks at her annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anne. You are too sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: And you are too uncaring and mean some days. Sarah turns her horse, she is apologetic, tries to joke h way out.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Some days I’m quite lovely though. Let’s think of them. Anne kicks her horse on, riding away from her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anne! Sarah lets her go. SARAH (CONT’D) You are such a child!

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY / CG DAY 62
dialogues.text: Abigail pushes Anne along a long hallway.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I guess all the rapes were the hardest. Made me feel at their mercy, that I was nothing.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 45.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You are not nothing. You are a dear person.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Thank you. You are so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Stop it. I am... you mock me.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I do not. If I was a man I would ravish you. Rrrrravish.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Enough!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I am sorry. Oh look. Through the glass on a terrace outside, a SMALL QUINTET o young aristocratic boys play. A middle aged man (MUSIC TEACHER) directs them. He has a riding crop and slaps it into legs and shoulders that are doing what they should. But it’s beautiful and fresh, joy even. As are they. Anne and Abigail watch through the window, entranced. The Anne becomes melancholic, a reminder of her own losses.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Make them stop.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: What? Anne suddenly gets up and starts banging on the window ha startling the young boys.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Stop! Enough! Stop! The music stops, the teacher and boys all freeze and star the Queen.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Enough!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Your Majesty?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Depart! All of you!! The teacher and boys, frightened by the Queen’s outburst, start to leave the terrace.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 46. 63 Anne limps off. Abigail follows her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I must rest.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Shall I...

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Leave me be!

dialogues.speaker: INT GOLDEN HALLWAY / CG DAY 63
dialogues.text: Anne limps along. She sees a woman walking along the hall holding a baby (COURTIER - WOMAN WITH BABY).

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Give me that! The woman can see it’s the Queen, but seeing the crazy lo in her eyes, instinctively resists handing the baby over.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Your Majesty I- Anne grabs for it. The woman runs away from her, terrifie Anne suddenly realises she doesn’t know where she is.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Where am 1? Where am 1? Page Boy 1 steps forward startling Anne.

dialogues.speaker: PAGE ONE
dialogues.text: Your Majesty. You are in the west hallway. She takes a swing at him, cuffing him in the side of the head.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: How dare you speak to me like that?! Abigail suddenly appears beside her.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Where did you go? Stupid girl. She digs her fingers into Abigail’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Take me back.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 64
dialogues.text: Anne lies on her bed, depressed. Abigail watches her. She eyes the crutches leaning on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Perhaps we should dance. Anne sits bolt upright and stares at her, furious.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You mock me! Abigail holds out two crutches.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: No. I just believe you can, that it would be cheering. And I would dearly like to dance with you. Anne stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 65
dialogues.text: Anne and Abigail stand next to each other. They both tap their crutches three times. They twirl. Slowly at first, then more and more intensely, following other. Anne becomes flushed with joy as they whirl and crutch. Abigail locks eyes with the Queen. It is intense. They fa over. They lie there hands clasped, eyes closed. Exhauste but happy. The footman opens the door. Sarah enters. Sees it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PALACE GROUNDS / EG DAY 66
dialogues.text: A shot rings out. A pigeon falls from the sky. A dog runs retrieve it. Abigail and Sarah stand shooting.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 48.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Twelve. Eleven. You are shooting exceptionally well Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You have taught me well.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I hope you have not found your time with the Queen too tedious.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Not at all. And if it gives you rest I am happy. Did you sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Like a shot badger.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The Queen is... an extraordinary person, even if it is not readily apparent. She has been stalked by tragedy. Abigail is startled.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: She seems quite lovely.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I will not burden you again.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I am quite happy to-

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I know you are. She will be angry if I do not appear soon. Take your shot. Abigail looks at her steely eyed and then glances over to boy with the pigeons in the cage.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: ‘Throw! The boy lets go of the bird, and Abigail suddenly turns h gun and shoots at the bird barely half a foot from the ca Sarah and the boy are shocked. Sarah’s shoes are sprayed the bird's blood. ABIGAIL (CONT’D) Thirteen.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 49. 67 Sarah looks at her. Abigail shrugs with a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t know what came over me. The Queen’s Page (2) comes running through the field hold a note. He approaches Sarah and pauses momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The Queen? I will be there directly. The Page looks at the note, a bit lost.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PAGE TWO
dialogues.text: The Queen... asks for ...her. He points to Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 67
dialogues.text: The door opens. Anne is excited.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I have brought us up some lobsters, we will race them and then eat them!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I hope you have three. Anne sees her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Oh, hello.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Well hello. You sent for Abigail to try and make me jealous I think.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Perhaps. Sarah grabs Anne by the throat and pushes her back. Anne barely keep her feet and ends up slammed against the wall Sarah looks at her, smiling. She shoves her hand between Anne’s legs.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They will be in with the lobsters in a minute.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 50.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Scared? Footsteps can be heard just outside the door. Neither Ann Sarah moves, they just breathe, slightly aroused by the danger, waiting for the other to give in. The doors swing open. Meg and Sally walk in carrying lobs in white gloved hands. Meg’s hand has a spot of blood on where she’s been nipped. Anne and Sarah pull their hands from each other suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think a moat is a bad idea. It is too old fashioned.

dialogues.speaker: MEG
dialogues.text: Maam, three rude and unruly crustaceans. Best with butter and lemon than to be played with, but as you will your majesty. They put them on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: INT BACKSTAIRS / WWS NIGHT 68
dialogues.text: Abigail, carrying a tray with two glasses and a bottle of champagne, walks into the back stairwell and is tripped. smash into tiny pieces. She looks up and sees Harley.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Hello. Remember me?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Mr Harley. You always unbalance me.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: So what's been happening?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: The Queen and Lady Marlborough are to race lobsters and then eat them.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Do you want to get punched?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: The Queen will announce the doubling of the landholders tax to Parliament.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Do you jest?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I do not think she is certain of it though.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 51.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: But Lady Marlborough is providing that certainty.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: That is all.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Why do I feel that is not all? Abigail suddenly has tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I am trying my best, I am.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, turn off the tears. Thank you. Have a pleasant evening. He walks off. Abigail instantly smiles wryly to herself.

dialogues.speaker: INT PARLIAMENT DAY 69
dialogues.text: Queen Anne stands before Parliament. She is about to spea Sarah watches from the gallery. Harley rises suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: May I speak a moment, with Her Majesty’s pleasure? May I exhort the chamber to roar a mighty hurrah for Her Majesty in her brilliant decision to not raise the land tax. There is a hurrah from the Tories. Anne is thrown a bit.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For the doubling of the tax would have been a disaster, and the fields would have run with blood as the countryside rose up against our city friends. To add to the piling dead of our sons on the field of this war. Again to our Queen for her deep wisdom in knowing where to draw the line in holding our country together. For there is no point winning a war abroad if we are to start one at home. The Tories hurrah.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 52. 70 Anne blushes. Sarah can’t believe it. Anne looks at her paper.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I apologise for the interruption Your Majesty. The floor is yours of course. We look forward to hearing what you have to say. Anne looks down at her paper and then at Sarah, who motio her on. Anne clears her throat. Anne looks back at the pa Is unsure what to do. Anne suddenly drops to the ground, if she’s fainted, silencing them all.

dialogues.speaker: EXT WOODS DAY 70
dialogues.text: Abigail is collecting flowers in the woods. She hears a noise, turns, but sees nothing. The wind whistles in the trees. Then another sharp scurrying noise. She freezes. Silence. scans the heavily wooded trees.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Who's there? More scurrying and a sound like the cry of a wolf. She dr her basket, panic stricken.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: Boo! Abigail falls down, startled and terrified. Masham stands there laughing. She gets up and cracks him as hard as she across the face. He is stunned. It hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Men should not sneak up on women. Abigail laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You look scared.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: I am hurt. Look.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I have just now decided to marry you Masham.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: I cannot marry a servant. I can enjoy one though.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 53. He reaches for her. She suddenly knees him in the balls. falls to his knees. She drops and kisses his twisted, pai mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I know it would ruin you to marry me. I will fix things for us.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: Who says I would marry you?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I am in your blood and you will not rest until I am pinned underneath you. But I will decide if and when that occurs. She puts his hand on her breasts.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say it is not so. He grabs at her. She pulls away. Stands, her crotch at hi face level.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't you think we are a good match? She runs off, laughing. He chases her, tackles her to the ground. Is on top of her. They breath heavily. MASHAM. I think a very good match. He starts to push her dress up.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Wait, kiss me properly first. They kiss. She rolls away. She runs to a tree, he is in hot pursuit. She moves sudde tripping him as he reaches her. He topples down the hillo to the other side. She looks down at him as he lies in the leaves. Masham looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: I am enthralled by you.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Of course you are. I am stealing your horse now. She walks off, taking his horse by the reins.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 54.

dialogues.speaker: INT PARLIAMENT DAY 72
dialogues.text: Empty Parliament. Anne sits looking forlorn with Sarah. Godolphin is nearby.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I looked like a fool. They were all staring weren't they? I can tell even if I cannot see. And I heard the word fat. Fat.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Anne.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: And ugly.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No one but me would dare, and I did not. I felt for you. He set you up. It is our fault.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I did not know what else to do. I could not... go through with it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s fine Anne. It’s fine. Footman (5) and (6) bring in her sedan chair and take Ann out of the chamber as Sarah walks over to Godolphin.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was ready for us.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: He probably just assumed you would have been working on the Queen.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: A minor hitch. We will reset the date.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 72
dialogues.text: Abigail walks around the room, slowly. She is still in he torn dress, admiring the ornate details of the Queen’s possessions. She fingers the jewels on Anne’s dressing ta Smiles at the rabbits. Touches the silk bed clothes.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 73
dialogues.text: The Queen on a crutch limps through her salon and into he apartment. She stops in her tracks and sees a startled Abigail's head in her bed.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 55. 74 75 76

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Oh Your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Lady Marlborough asked me to wait for you and I was... and then the bed looked so beautiful and I was overcome... with, with foolishness. I am sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You may get out now. Abigail gets out. She is naked. She walks slowly over to her clothes. Anne watches as Abi leisurely puts her clothes back on, basking in the attent

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Apologies again Your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: What happened to your dress?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Wolves. Abigail curtsies and exits. INT ABIGAIL’S BEDROOM ‘NIGHT Abigail lies in bed. A banging on Abigail’s door.

dialogues.speaker: INT GOLDEN HALLWAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: 74 15 Abigail in her nightdress, barefoot, follows a Footman (2 Not sure what is happening. INT ANNE’S APARTMENTS NIGHT Abigail is led into the Queen’s apartments.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTMAN 2
dialogues.text: Her legs. Abigail enters.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Rub my legs. Abigail starts to massage her legs. 16  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 56.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Does it hurt a lot?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: (deadpan) It is agony. Abigail starts massaging higher and higher up Anne’s legs Anne doesn’t stop her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Oh the pain. Abigail's hands disappear under Anne’s night dress. Anne tilts her head back, closes her eyes. cur TO

dialogues.speaker: INT SARAH'S QUARTERS NIGHT 7
dialogues.text: Godolphin is at the door to Sarah's apartment. Sarah in h nightgown. He holds a letter.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Marlborough has written. He is in position, the battle will begin any time. Sarah takes and reads the letter quickly. A flicker of fe on her face.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He will prevail.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: I imagine you will not sleep tonight. T can stay and sit with you? I could regale you with witty tales of my romantic exploits, and by exploits I mean humiliations, and some weeping.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You are sweet Godolphin which may explain the humiliations. I am alright. She shuts the door. Alone. Is agitated by the news. She goes, opens the panel in the wall, steps through.

dialogues.speaker: INT SECRET PASSAGEWAY NIGHT 78
dialogues.text: Sarah walks quickly along the passageway. She reaches the door of the Queen’s salon, takes her key and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Mrs Morley? INT ANNE’S APARTMENTS NIGHT 79 There is no answer. Sarah gently opens the door to the ro and sees the two women asleep in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: INT SECRET PASSAGEWAY NIGHT 80
dialogues.text: Sarah walks along the hallway, veers sideways, has to sto herself, hold herself up by the wall. She continues walking in a daze. Stops. A small sob cracks from her chest.

dialogues.speaker: INT SARAH'S QUARTERS DAY 81
dialogues.text: Abigail enters carrying a book, she walks happily into Sarah's quarters.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Good morning Lady Marlborough Sarah is on a ladder examining some books on her bookshel Sarah drops the heavy book she is holding. It grazes Abigail’s shoulder. She is knocked to the floor, startled

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Where is that book of poetry from the Dryden fellow?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I do not- Sarah starts throwing books off the shelves. They rain do on Abigail, striking her, one in the face.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No! No! No! A thin line of blood trickles from Abigail’s nose. Sarah drops from the ladder and lands next to her. Abigail push herself backwards along the floor, away from Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I do not understand.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 58.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Did you take it? My book!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: No I-

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I think you are a pretty little liar that I have misjudged. Abigail realises what it’s actually about. Sarah grabs her by the face and squeezes it.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I did not mean for this to happen. The Queen, she is forceful and -

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You are dismissed from my service. Go back to Mrs Meg tell her to find you a position in the scullery. If she asks why, tell her ‘Because I am a disloyal little bitch’. Shocked and upset, Abigail takes a moment to compose hers She curtsies.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: As you wish your Ladyship. It has been my privilege and honour to -

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: If you do not go, I will start kicking you and I will not stop. Abigail nods, departs hurriedly. We follow her into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY / A
dialogues.text: Abigail stands there, unsure of what to do. She suddenly herself hard in the face with the book she is holding. Th blood starts to run again from her nose. Then tears. She checks her face in a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 83
dialogues.text: Anne is resting on a chaise lounge when she hears crying. See gets up, walks with her crutch, opens the door and se the bloodied and tearful Abigail, standing there.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 59. 84

dialogues.speaker: INT PALACE COURTYARD / SF DAY 84
dialogues.text: A carriage sits in the driveway. Anne is being carried in sedan chair down the steps of the palace. Sarah walks nex her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You have become close to Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: She has been a dear. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It is such a shame but I have dismissed her for theft. She is a liar and a thief. Beat. SARAH (CONT’D) Your tongue seems uncharacteristically still.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I heard you. Abigail walks past Sarah and waits by the door of the Que carriage. Sarah stares at her, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She is my servant, she is not dismissed. I have made her my Maid of the Bedchamber.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Did you not hear what I said?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You regard her as a liar and a thief.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I do not. Obviously. Sarah stares at Anne, pulls her close to her and whispers her ear.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You will dismiss her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: (whispers back) I will not. I like it when she puts her tongue inside me.

dialogues.speaker: THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17
dialogues.text: Sarah stands motionless, shocked by Anne’s comment. Anne climbs in the carriage assisted by Abigail. Abigail gives Sarah the slightest hint of a smile. Gets in the carriage

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go! The carriage takes off, leaving Sarah standing there, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: INT CARRIAGE DAY 87
dialogues.text: Abigail reads to Anne in the curtained compartment. They together in happy contentment. There is a sudden noise of banging on the carriage. Start them. CROWD 1 0/s It's that fucking bitch! My sons a cripple you cunt!

dialogues.speaker: CROWD 2 0/S
dialogues.text: Stop the carnage you stuck up whore! A startled Anne looks at Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Don’t they know who it is?

dialogues.speaker: CROWD 3 0/S
dialogues.text: Queen cunt!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I think they do. Anne takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: oh. CROWD 4 0/s Warmongering Slag! She pulls back the curtain a little, a man with one eye stares back at her. Screams at her. A dozen other people behind him chasing the carriage shouting. She shuts the curtain fast. Is shaken. Abigail moves quickly beside her Holds her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: What are they shouting?  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 61.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Driver! Faster! (to Anne) Close your eyes. Sing a song with me. Will you be my Love? Do you know it? It is marvellous. She cups a hand over one of Anne’s ears, and sings into t other one distracting Anne from the noise outside. Anne calms down a little bit, distracted, charmed, the no starts to recede as the carriage speeds up. Anne curls in her.

dialogues.speaker: INT MUD BATHS DAY 89
dialogues.text: Anne is up to her neck in a large pool of bubbling mud. Abigail sits on a stool next to her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: It is so strange to be in this.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It is good for you. The doctor says it will leach the toxins.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: What if I go to sleep and slip under?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Just imagine it is hot chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: At least I would die happy. A door opens. Sarah enters in a robe. She lets it fall to floor and enters the bath.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: After you left I thought, what a grand idea to take to the mud. To get whatever poisons one carries with one out. She settles into the mud opposite Anne. Abigail and her e each other.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Abigail could you fetch me some refreshment?  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 62.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I would like of course but I must be at the Queen’s side and behest at all times. It is my role.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Such loyalty. How delightful it is when one tries to cultivate a new trait in one’s character.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Do not scratch at her. Beat. They sit there a moment. Sarah takes a finger of mu and draws a moustache across her lip.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Mr Freeman. Anne laughs. Does the same with the mud.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Mr Morley.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How handsome you are.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Oh Mr Freeman, you are handsome.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh but I forgot my glasses. She draws circles round her eyes. Anne laughs. Abigail tr to smile, join in, but is unnerved by it.

dialogues.speaker: INT CARRIAGE DAY 90
dialogues.text: The three of them travel back together. Anne and Sarah on side. Abigail on the other. Anne sleeps. Sarah whispers v quietly, almost to herself.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You will be back in the street. Abigail looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: INT GOLDEN HALLWAY NIGHT 91
dialogues.text: Sarah and Anne walk. Abigail follows, a step behind them.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 63.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Remember when we were young and were not allowed out in the snow, and we opened all the windows in the ballroom and sat there as snow flurries just wafted in. And when your governess came in we were making a snowman and our hands were blue. Anne laughs. Takes Sarah’s hand and presses it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Oh that was such fun.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Sounds marvellous.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So many things we have done together.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (mumbling) I do love ancient history.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Abigail, did you say something?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I was singing. I cannot get a tune out of my head.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Well there is so much room for it. Abigail laughs uproariously.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Lady Marlborough. You are such a wit.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You are a dear Abigail. I shall retire for the evening.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (eagerly) Shall I prepare your bed Queen Anne?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Or shall you and I adjourn to your apartments for sherry? A beat. She eyes them both. The moment of choice.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 64.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: A sherry sounds just the ticket. Abigail's face falls.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good night Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yes, good night dear Abigail. Anne and Sarah walk off, hands clasped together. Leaving Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are enjoying all this aren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: To be beloved. Of course. To see you trying to win me. Why, what is not to love my dear?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You will stop this ridiculous infatuation. You have made your point.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Perhaps I was not making a point. They look at each other. Anne kisses her suddenly. 92 INT ABIGAIL’S BEDROOM NIGHT 92 Abigail sits in a chair, focused but ranting. Masham sits next to her blithely smoking.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Perhaps because of my past, perhaps some malformation of my heart... I blame my father of course... cunt ++I must take control of my circumstance. I will need to act in a way that meets the edges of my morality. To trust is to risk, and when I end up living on the street selling my arsehole to syphilitic soldiers, steadfast morality will be a fucking nonsense that will mock me daily.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: I’m not quite following.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Shhhhh.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 65. He's hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I apologise. But... do shhhh when I’m thinking. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 93
dialogues.text: Morning. Abigail brushes Anne’s hair.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Your hair is so lustrous. It is something people in court comment on.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Really. I always thought of it as nest like. Sarah enters.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (to Anne) I shall make you tea. Abigail goes to a side table where pots and cups are.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What a lovely idea. Thank you Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
