dialogues.text: (to Sarah) Pat the kids hello. Sarah eyes her, and the rabbits. It is a challenge and sh knows it. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Of course. She leans over the little temporary rabbit hutch and pats them, grimacing. Anne smiles. Abigail takes some Lily of the Valley flowers from her ap She pushes them into the pot adding hot water and tea mak sure that the two women don’t notice it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You will give that speech on the tax increase in parliament next week.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I dreamed of the man on the roadside with one eye.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What man?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: When we drove through town. He stared at me in such a way. I felt my blood chill. Abigail takes a cup of tea over to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So kind. Sarah drinks her tea. Takes a petit four, tosses it in th air and catches it in her mouth. Abigail smiles at Sarah, unnerving her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Abigail. Do you think people are angry?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Anne! She does not know.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: We should ask people. Bring a group of people from the villages in and ask them.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That is not how matters of state are dealt with. People are led, they do not lead! Would you leave Marlborough exposed? He needs another battalion ready to join him. And that means money.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Do not yell at me! I am the Queen!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Then for once act like it! Sarah walks out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT STABLES DAY 94
dialogues.text: Sarah walks through the garden. Horses are being prepared be ridden. Masham stands there holding two horses. Is abo to speak.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: Is the Queen to-

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Do not speak to me. Sarah mounts a horse and takes off. She grimaces as she rides. A slight pain in her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: EXT WOODS DAY 95
dialogues.text: Sarah is galloping through a wooded area. Sarah suddenly doubles over with pain, a flop sweat break out across her face. She pulls the horse to a walk. Sarah blinks hard trying to pull herself together. She suddenly throws up. The horse starts to gallop. She pulls listlessly at the reins. Her bowels suddenly open noisily. She topples over. Gets foot caught in the stirrup. The horse gallops on as her h hits the ground and she is dragged, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: INT GOLDEN HALLWAY DAY 96
dialogues.text: Abigail walks the hallway determinedly. Shrieking, giggli and yelling can be heard. A pomegranate comes flying out the doorway of a room ahead. It hits the wall and smashes bloody pink seeds everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: INT DRAWING ROOM DAY 97
dialogues.text: A group of painted up Tories including Harley have a youn man naked (POMEGRANATE TORY) and are playing dodgeball wi him, using pomegranates as balls. The wall is spattered bright pink. The young man tries to dodge but gets hit wi one. He goes down and they all slam more pomegranates int him. Abigail appears in the doorway. The men all yell lewd things at her. A pomegranate juice spattered Harley comes to her.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I have thought on the terms of our friendship.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: I thought it was unconditional love.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 68.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I will get you an audience with the Queen if you ask her a favour for me.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Wench. You will-

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Harley you do not need me as an enemy. As it turns out I am capable of much unpleasantness.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: As am I.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (angrily) It’s so tiring to be like this! (calmer) The Queen has taken a shine to me and I will drip poison into her ear regarding you, until she is mad with hatred for you. Or we will have a mutually advantageous friendship. Count of three. Yes or no? He stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: If you are so close to the Queen, why not just ask this favour yourself?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I do not want her to ever think I want anything from her.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: And have you counselled her for our side?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Why not? The country’s future hangs in the balance.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Uh huh. My thing is what I wish to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: You do not care? I thought you were on our side.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I am on my side. Always. Sometimes it is a happy coincidence for you. Like now, you will get a chance to save the country.

dialogues.speaker: EXT WOODS NIGHT 98
dialogues.text: The horse walks through the woods. The woods are thicker darker. In the moonlight they pass a man fucking a woman against tree. The woman MAE, watches impassively as the horse dra Sarah past her. The man pulls up his pants and goes. Mae leaves her tree, walks, takes a look at Sarah, then t the horse’s lead and leads it away, Sarah dragging along behind it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PALACE LAWNS / SF DAY 99
dialogues.text: Harley walks beside the Queen.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: What tremendous luck to find you in the garden.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: We were taking the air. Abigail watches on from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: You do not like the war. I know that.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: No. I do not. But we must... fight... for what we fight for.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Godolphin and Lady Marlborough seem to have corralled you, so that you do not get to hear from your loyal opposition.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I am briefed appropriately.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Were it in person I'd believe it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I am often ill.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: True. Sadly true. The war with the French will bleed us dry even if we win. We are in our strongest position now. If Marlborough loses this next battle we could lose all. Anne takes this in for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The people hate the war you realise. They begin to hate you. Anne is quiet as she considers what Harley is

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lady Marlborough has not told you of the riots in Leeds?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: No. But there was a man with one eye that was...very distressing.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: All I ask is that you search your heart.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Not Lady Marlborough’s heart. Your own. I must also talk to you of your maid.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: I believe that is her name. It seems Colonel Masham has fallen for her, he wishes to marry.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: But she is a maid.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: It is irregular and inexplicable but being sentimental I am moved to help if possible.

dialogues.speaker: MAR 17
dialogues.text: saying. 100 ae es es

dialogues.speaker: INT DRAWING ROOM DAY 101
dialogues.text: Anne has gathered with Godolphin, Masham and a few soldie Abigail stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: What do you mean she has not been seen?!

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: She took a horse. It did not come back and nor did she. Anne takes this in, as does Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: I shall send riders.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 71. 102 103

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I think she means to vex me. Do not send riders.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: In case she has fallen though.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: She is too good a rider too fall. I know what she is... Do not seek her.

dialogues.speaker: INT BROTHEL BEDROOM DAY 102
dialogues.text: Sarah is sweating and feverish, she has an open wound gou into her cheek and bruises and abrasions. She comes to, o her eyes. A man with his trousers down is fucking a woman against the wall from behind across from her. Mae sits be her sips from a flask of whisky.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: You're in heaven. That’s God. You'll meet him later.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I must... go. Sarah tries to get up but throws up over herself.

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s happening. Lie back. Mae takes her flask. MAE (CONT’D) Stop infection. She pours some on Sarah’s wound. Intense pain shoots thro Sarah. She passes out. INT ANNE’S APARTMENTS NIGHT 103 Anne wakes up bathed in sweat, struggling for breath, clutching at her chest. She rings the bell by her bedside Footman 3 comes in.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Get Lady Marlborough. He goes to leave but before he can she screams.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just take.. me to her!

dialogues.speaker: INT GOLDEN HALLWAY NIGHT 104
dialogues.text: Footman 3 wheels the Queen in her chair as she writhes in pain, struggling for breath, panicky. They enter Sarah's quarters. No Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Find her!

dialogues.speaker: INT SARAH'S QUARTERS NIGHT 105
dialogues.text: The Footman (3) searches vainly, in cupboards, under the He shrugs at Anne. She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS NIGHT 106
dialogues.text: Anne sits up on her bed, her breathing labored. Pails of water steam up the room helping her breathing. Sally and Meg bring in more steaming pails set them down and leave xoom. Abigail rubbing a cream into her back as the doctor takes her pulse. Godolphin stands by.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: We must look for her! She could die out there! There are wolves out there are there not?

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: No Your Majesty. I don’t think so. There are bandits and...

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I think there are wolves! Find her! She slumps back in her bed.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PALACE GROUNDS / SF NIGHT 107
dialogues.text: Ten riders some military, some courtiers head into the fo with lit torches. Godolphin, in his robe, watches them depart.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 108
dialogues.text: Anne sits on a chair in the middle of the room, she is dressed and her symptoms have passed. Harley and Godolphi facing her. Abigail sits off to one side, feeding Godolph duck bits of fruit.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 73.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: No one knows where she is?

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: No one has heard or seen of her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I thought she was... She gets up. Goes to her rabbits.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What if she is-

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Perhaps she has gone to Blenheim, her palace?

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: There is no palace yet. It is the woods.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Well we should check in the trees just to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Mr Harley!

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: I apologise. I hope we find her, and she is not dead in a ditch. The business of state however cannot stop. The Prime Minister has a ludicrous and costly idea to-

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Your majesty. There has been no word from the front in two weeks. There is no doubt that Marlborough is in trouble. We need to send a division immediately to help him.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: (to Godolphin) costing a fortune, and built on your paranoia and walking into God know what? The messengers could've been killed, found a whore they liked the taste of. Or it could all be done and we have lost and they walk into an ambush.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Your Majesty I beg of you. Immediate action is needed. Funds, men.

dialogues.speaker: THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17
dialogues.text: Anne shifts uncomfortably, unused to dealing with things without Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: We need to wait.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I... well... I will... think on it for a-

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: This cannot wait. We need to act now. Beat. Anne nods, but struggles as to what to do. Abigail suddenly speaks up from her position seated at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Is it somewhat like going late to a party. If the party’s going well, they did not need you and resent the intrusion. If it is going badly, you cannot save it, but tend to get excruciatingly bored and regret you ever put on your nice gown for it. They look over at her.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: It is not like a party!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Prime Minister, a passing thought.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I think it is like a party.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: A perfect analogy.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: We will wait. But they should be in their dresses ready to go at a moments notice. Shift a division to the coast and have a boat at the ready. Godolphin, furious, walks to his duck and picks up the le

dialogues.speaker: INT BROTHEL BEDROOM DAY 109
dialogues.text: Sarah pushes herself upright, she is a bit better, but st weak. She steadies herself, across the room. The big man, God, real name Kevin, sits there.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 75. She picks up a hand mirror and looks at the damage to her face. The gouge has a couple of rough stitches in it and scabbed over.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Boy. Fetch me a carriage. He looks at up her. Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Mae says no.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m leaving. Help me up.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Shut up. Or I’1l give you something to do with your mouth. Sarah stands up. He stands up. He pulls a hard leather co out of his pocket, lazily smashes the cup that sits on a table next to him. Stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mae says no. Mae says no.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why don’t you think for yourself?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I can hurt you if I have to. She said. But I get to decide if I have to. So that is thinking for myself. Mae enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: Feeling better then?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Is my horse alive or did you eat it?

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: I sold it. Still didn’t pay for your upkeep. But you look better. Don’t worry about the face, some men like that. Not many, but some.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Thank you for your kindness but I need to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: You still owe me though. You can suck for your supper from now on. I'll take twenty percent. You seem posh, gents will like that.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anne lies

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen ten gold sovereigns?

dialogues.speaker: MAE
dialogues.text: In my dreams.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Go to Hyde Park fountain at nine in the morning and you'll see a man walking a duck. 110 in bed, a bit feverish. Abigail sits with her. A cold compress on her head. Anne's eyes flip open. She seems

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Abigail. I worry something has befallen her. It is night. out there alone.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: She is strong. She will be fine.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, she will. She saved me my whole life. Without her I am nothing. devastated.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: That is not true. You are the Queen.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I am tired. It hurts, everything hurts. Everyone leaves me. Dies. Finally her. She closes her eyes for a beat. Then suddenly opens them. anger in them this time.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If she is not dead, I will cut her throat. She may be trying to hurt me, make me dissolve and dissemble and... I will not!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Sssh. She is fine. They will find her.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 77.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I do not care. You are such a beautiful person. You glow with... loveliness. We must marry you.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Colonel Masham wishes to marry you.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: He does?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Yes. You have captured him.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: That is... absurd. I have nothing to offer. I am a penniless servant. It would be career suicide.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Your first thought is for him? You are a darling.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I care for him. Not as I care for you, but enough to marry. I will not lie, I would like to be a Lady again. I am not perfect.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. She gets up.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is right. While she is gone. If we wait she will return and yell and stomp about it. But you must have this. It is a gift I give you and I demand you take it.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Of course. When will-

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Now! Of course it must be now! iii INT CHAPEL NIGHT iil A garland of white flowers sits on Abigail’s head. Abigai face is masked by her veil. Her and Masham stand in front a chaplain.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 78. 112 Anne and Harley are the only guests. Harley is unmade up. Sleep in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: I, Samuel Masham, take thee, Abigail Hill, to be my lawful wedded wife.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I, Abigail Hill, take thee, Samuel Masham, to be my lawful wedded husband. Masham places the ring on Abigail's finger.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: With this ring I thee wed, with my body I thee worship, and with all my worldly goods I thee endow. They kiss. Anne applauds, as does Harley.

dialogues.speaker: INT PRIVY PURSE OFFICE NIGHT 112
dialogues.text: Abigail sits at the table. She enters “2000 Guineas” into ledger. Anne, Harley and Masham look on.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It is most generous. I am overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Shall we say ‘gambling debts’ Mr Harley?

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Excellent. Abigail writes ‘gambling debts’ against the figure. She t the ledger around to Harley. Harley signs off on it. Anne hands Abigail a promissory note with a seal on it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You are to take apartments on the east wing.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: Thank you Your Majesty. Abigail smiles. Jumps up and down happily.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Thank you! Thank you! They pop champagne.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: It is fun to be Queen sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: One can only imagine. 113 INT ABIGAIL’S BEDROOM NIGHT 113 Masham lies on the bed, semi naked. Abigail’s at the wind staring out into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: You're looking the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Where could she have gone? You rode through the forest looking for her?

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: I have told you before.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: She would be sick, for several days, but she would be near recovered by now. MASHAM. She probably went back to Southampton.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: To do what? To plan what? To get ready, to-

dialogues.speaker: MASHAM
dialogues.text: I am as hard as a rock and it is our wedding night! She goes and sits on the bed. He reaches for her. She pus him away.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Lie still. She puts her hand under the sheet and gives him a hand jo she continues talking.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now she is gone I find myself more concerned than when she was here. For it is like she could strike from anywhere at anytime, and I will not see it coming. He moans.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sssh. I must be calm. She is gone, I am married. But I must be ready and yet how to be ready when one does not see the enemy. My life is a maze I continually think I have found a way out of, only to find another corner in front of me. He groans loudly. Cums. She stares blankly ahead.

dialogues.speaker: 114A INT BROTHEL CORRIDOR DAY 114A
dialogues.text: A bemused Godolphin leading a duck follows MAE past semi naked whores and clients.

dialogues.speaker: INT BROTHEL DAY 115
dialogues.text: Sarah sits on her bed. The door opens, it’s Mae with Godolphin and his duck. Godolphin barks out a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: What happened, are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That cunt Abigail poisoned me, Mary Magdalene found me.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Did they rape you?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No they didn’t, but gainful employment is on offer should I need it.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Abigail did this?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yes. How goes the Kingdom?

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: The Queen is considering a peace treaty offer to the French. And to switch two positions in cabinet to them. Harley suddenly has her ear.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Had. Had her ear. Take me home. She stands. Nods to Kevin who nods back. She exits.

dialogues.speaker: INT DRAWING ROOM EVENING 116
dialogues.text: A court tea. A dozen Ladies including Abigail in a new dr are talking and having tea. A young boy sits at a piano playing as a woman accompanie him in song. She finishes and there is polite applause. T Ladies go back to talking. They are suddenly aware of Sarah walking into the room.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ladies. All the Ladies stop talking and look to her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, I could always silence a room. Abigail stands.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh dear, the servant is dressed in the clothes of a Lady. How whimsical. Is it a game of some sort? Some of the Ladies titter.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Lady Sarah, my dear friend and cousin, how good to see you have returned from...?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hell. I’m sure you will pass through it sometime.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You have missed a few things. My marriage. It was a simple affair but beautifully done.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Everyone leave. Abigail stays where she is as the others depart.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you offer me tea, you'll forgive me if I shan’t accept.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I searched my heart and I did not have trust in it and that is my shame. I could not just stand by and let you destroy me. You maybe taught me that. But it is over now. I have won, I am safe. We do not need to fight anymore. Is that not grand? If you just forgive me, we can be happy together. Sarah slaps her three times across the face. Abigail fall the floor. She looks up at Sarah.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 82.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Obviously you have some anger to expiate. I will allow it this once. Sarah smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Congratulations on your wedded bliss. She walks out. Abigail lies on the floor. Smiles to herse 117 INT ANNE’S APARTMENTS NIGHT 117 Anne is asleep in bed. Sarah unlocks the secured door and enters. She sits on the bed. Watches Anne for a second. L over and blows air in her face. Anne flickers awake. Stares at her, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Your face.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Do I look that bad? If I was a man it would seem quite dashing, a scar like this.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Where have you been Sarah? Why did you leave like that?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I went riding, some bandits attacked me, it took me a while to fight them off.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Your poor face.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You should see them. And you have been well I trust? Well taken care of. Men were eventually sent to find me I hear.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I worried for you. I... thought you were... You did not do it to hurt me?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I do not play games with you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I know. I know.

dialogues.speaker: THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17
dialogues.text: Anne gets up and moves to her night table puts on a robe. Sarah goes to her takes her hand, gently.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Look at me. I will say this plainly and once my dearest one, you must. send Abigail away. Anne stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: From my heart Mrs Morley. Do it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I do not want to.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: She is a viper.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You are jealous, it is very sweet. You always said I needed too much love from you. Now with you both I have enough. Please accept that. Love her as me. You have been rather mean to her, I would also like that to change.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You will do as I tell you. A loud knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTMAN 0/S
dialogues.text: The Prime Minister and Mr Harley!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Not - A footman opens the door. Harley and Godolphin enter. Godolphin clutching a note.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is itl?

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: A thousand pardons your Majesty. But word from the front.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What has happened?

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Marlborough is ready, he has them outflanked. He needs a garrison to attack the coast.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We must prepare quickly.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: The Queen has already readied a garrison.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Let them go to the party now. Sarah is caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What...party?

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Of course your majesty.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: It happened while you were gone. Thank you gentleman, keep me informed of all progress. Anne is pleased and bolstered by her decision

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You may leave. I would like to speak to the Queen alone.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Yes. Leave us. They bow and make their way to the exit.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: It is good to see you home and looking so well Lady Marlborough. They traipse out. Sarah composes herself. The doors shut.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Now, You did very well with the divisions.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I know I did.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: However the two new Cabinet positions they must stay with the whigs.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I am the Queen. Do not try to that thing you do.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Do not try to manage this as you cannot. I know Harley has been in your ear and Abigail in your -

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Enough! You must be as I wish you to be now. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Anne Sarah takes her hand, tries to pull her into a kiss. Anne pushes her away.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Don't. Sarah pushes her against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your face frightens me. Don’t. They struggle, Sarah pushing herself on Anne, Anne spinni her, so that Sarah lands on the ground on her arse.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good night Lady Marlborough.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You do not do this! You do not! Anne leaves and walks away. The door opens, where Sarah s Abigail is holding it open. The Queen exits, the door shu

dialogues.speaker: INT SARAH'S QUARTERS NIGHT 119
dialogues.text: Sarah lies in bed awake, staring at the ceiling. She has face plaster over her injury now. She gets up, goes to he drawer and pulls out bundles of letters.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 120
dialogues.text: Anne blinks awake. As Sarah throws back the drapes.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I think I'm becoming quite sentimental as I get older.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I don’t think you have the capacity for sentimentality.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I didn’t think so either, but so much is surprising me lately. I started looking over some of the many, many, many letters you've written to me. She pulls some out, starts quoting from them. SARAH (CONT’D) ‘I long for your embrace’, ‘I long for the heat’ from your naked body on mine.’ Very intense. Very... explicit.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: What are you-

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I thought I’d misplaced some of them the other day. Quite a fright. What if say that son of a bitch Jonathan Swift got them? In his newspaper the next day? You would be ruined. Anne stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You would never.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You have no idea what I would do for my country. And for you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Ruin me? You would do that?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I will use these letters unless you announce the tax rise, change the Cabinet as I wish, and get rid of Abigail. She gets up and leaves. 121 INT PARLIAMENT DAY 12. The Whigs and Tories gather on either side of the Parliam They wait.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 122
dialogues.text: Abigail is dressing Anne for the Parliament. Anne sits, staring out the window. Abigail lifts the crown, briefly it on her head, likes the look of it. She walks over to A  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 87.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Do you not wish to know what I have decided?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I wish to know you are happy and that your spirit will lighten once this is done.

dialogues.speaker: INT SARAH'S QUARTERS DAY 123
dialogues.text: Sarah stands by her desk getting ready. She looks at the pile of Anne’s letters, flips one open. Reads it. She smiles. Tears well up in her eyes. Suddenly takes the letters and throws them in the fire. A Courtier (SPEAKING COURTIER) enters.

dialogues.speaker: COURTIER
dialogues.text: The Queen requests the return of your key. You will return it and vacate Court today.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: COURTIER
dialogues.text: You are to hand over the key. The Queen will not grant you an audience. She takes the key from around her waist and hands it to h

dialogues.speaker: INT SECRET PASSAGEWAY DAY 124
dialogues.text: Sarah walks fast down the secret hallway. She bangs on th door. Sarah peers through the keyhole. She can see Anne sitting her bed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Anne! I handed over my key. Anne ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are angry I know. I am sorry. I went quite mad for a moment. Just open the door. Anne ignores her.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 88.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I burnt the letters. I burnt them. Do what you will. Sarah hears Anne get up and come to the door. She waits. Anne considers opening the door, but stops herself. She presses her forehead on the door.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I will not come back. Do you understand! I will go and be gone! Abigail has done this. She does not love you!

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Because how could anyone? She wants nothing from me! Unlike you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: She wants nothing from you, and yet somehow she is a Lady with two thousand a year, and Harley sits on your knee most nights.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I wish you would love me as she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wish me to lie to you ‘Oh you look like an angel that fell from heaven your Majesty’. No! Some days you look like a badger. And you can rely on me to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Because I will not lie! That is love! Anne stops a beat.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I must go attend to my duties. Walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: INT SECRET PASSAGEWAY DAY 125
dialogues.text: A dazed Sarah walks back along the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: INT PARLIAMENT DAY 126
dialogues.text: Whigs on one side. Tories on the other. Anne enters. They stand. They all bow. She takes her papers out. Looks at t Godolphin looks for Sarah. Anne clears her throat.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I have. I have over the last several months been unhappy with the government. Lord Godolphin has lost my confidence. Therefore I am announcing the new Prime Minister will be Mr. Harley. Godolphin, I thank you for your service. We will sue for peace with France immediately. I have spoken. All depart. A shell-shocked silence. Then all hell breaks loose, as A walks from the stage. Comes out into:

dialogues.speaker: INT SARAH'S QUARTERS DAY 127
dialogues.text: Servants and Footman (2) are in her apartments, piling th into boxes. Sarah stares at them. Abigail stands by supervising. She has the key around her waist. A servant moves a couch.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Leave that. I like it. Abigail smiles at Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am moving in. The rug stays too.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh my God. You actually think you have won.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Haven't 1? Abigail twirls the key.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We were playing very different games.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Well, all I know is, your carriage awaits and my maid’s on her way up with something called a pineapple.

dialogues.speaker: THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17
dialogues.text: 128 129 130 131 132 133 134 INT ANNE’S APARTMENTS NIGHT 128 Anne stands alone by the window. She watches as Sarah walks past outside, servants carryin her bags. A sadness on her face.

dialogues.speaker: INT CARRIAGE / SF NIGHT 129
dialogues.text: Sarah sits in the carriage, luggage beside her. She looks back at the palace. Hoping Anne might come out, for some reprieve.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Go? Sarah waits a moment longer. Then, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Go. The carriage pulls away. cur To

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED- MOVED TO 137B 131
dialogues.text: OMITTED- MOVED To 137¢ 132

dialogues.speaker: INT GREAT HALL NIGHT 134
dialogues.text: A dinner party is going on. An acrobat performs. Abigail holds court at the head of the table. She is a bit drunk. MAGICIAN makes fire come out his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Do it again! He does. She excitedly picks up a glass and hurls at the wall. It smashes. Everyone roars with laughter. And follo suit. She goes and sits on a soldier’s lap. Masham watche her. A courtier comes to her.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 91.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS NIGHT 135
dialogues.text: Anne is at a table, she is trying to work on papers. She can’t see clearly and uses a magnifying glass. One of her arms hangs limply at her side. Abigail trips over as she enters.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: ow... I am here.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Do my legs please.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Of course. (to the maid) Hot towels now! Abigail goes and gets a silver dish of the paste. She wob a bit as she walks.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Are you drunk?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I have had wine. Very good wine. I could get you some. It would ease you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: No. Abigail starts massaging the paste into her legs..

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I do not understand these

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: papers.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I am feeling unwell. Excuse me a moment... Abigail suddenly gets up, goes and throws up in a nearby vase.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. I am unwell.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Lay down and I will fetch the doctor my love.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Thank you. Abigail lays on the couch. Anne winces in pain. Tries to refocus on the papers. Abigail starts snoring.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is sitting, staring at the Blenheim model. Godolphi with her.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: How is early retirement?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Dull. What goes on?

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: They have brokered a peace with the French, giving up too much of course.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Marlborough returns in a week.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Harley will move to have him replaced.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: ++.T hadn't seen it, but of course.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I will rip his mole from his face. You must stop it Godolphin.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: I only have so much sway without you there.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I will tell you how, and you must use my words.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: It would be easier to pull my strings if you were back at court. Beat

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Obviously you have chosen to keep the particulars of your dismissal from me. I shall leave a gap in the conversation for you to remedy that. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17
dialogues.text: GODOLPHIN (CONT’D) I do not know of women and their feelings. But I know they nurse their hurts like wailing newborns.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Godolphin, I feel a surge of desire to see your nose broken. Your point?

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: A letter. An apology of some sort that facilitates your return. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: There are limits to what one can give.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: You once told me quite the opposite. Beat

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How is Anne? Happy?

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: She seems...as mercurial as ever. Her health suffers however. Sarah considers this.

dialogues.speaker: 137A INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY 137A
dialogues.text: Anne sits in a chair, a rug on her knees, she is asleep, left arm hangs limply be her side. She snaps awake, focus and is slightly surprised to see she is surrounded by a d members of the cabinet. Harley holds court.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Now that the peace with France has been made- A cheer goes up from half the cabinet. Godolphin looks gl

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marlborough’s return back to England is imminent. I wonder Your Majesty whether it is right that he is left as head of our forces?

dialogues.speaker: THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17
dialogues.text: Godolphin is outraged.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: He is a hero who won the peace for us!

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Indeed. But he would have launched us into a bloody war that would have ruined us. So there’s that.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: We have made a poor peace that we will rue. Anne grunts and tries to compose herself, sit up. Sally c and picks her arm up and places it on the pillow on her l Harley forges on.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Well, our people are happy. I suggest, Queen Anne, that as a gesture of our graciousness to France perhaps he should be stood aside? A new era of peace and prosperity, a new day, a door to a new future, metaphors abound.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: It will look like we surrendered and the palace will be surrounded with men who lost eyes and arms in the war angry at this slight on their leader.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Men with...

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: They will stare in at us with rage.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: What a preposterous idea Godolphin. What are you-

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I...a...am tired it. Thank you all. +I will ponder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harley bows. The members of cabinet begin to file out. Godolphin lingers.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Your Majesty, may I broach the matter of Lady Marlborough?

dialogues.speaker: THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: No. You may not.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: A breach in a dear friendship, surely this could be healed?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Some wounds will not close. I have many such. One just walks around with them. Sometimes one can feel them filling with blood.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 95.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Quite. Lady Marlborough is a woman of passion. Perhaps she behaved rashly and is apologetic for her behaviors?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You know this?

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: I... believe it to be so. Anne takes this in. GODOLPHIN (CONT’D) Her love and loyalty to you and this country are her reasons for living. Perhaps she could write you and we could attempt to repair at least one wound in our Queen?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I cannot stop her. IT would imagine it is pointless and I would dash the letter into the fire. But... I cannot stop her. Godolphin nods with a small smile.

dialogues.speaker: 137B INT PRIVY PURSE OFFICE DAY 1373
dialogues.text: A noisy rabble stand before Abigail, pressing their claim

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Shut up please.

dialogues.speaker: SHUT UP
dialogues.text: Harley enters. The room silences.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: We will reconvene with some order and grace after lunch. 137C EXT GARDENS DAY 137¢ Abigail walks with Harley.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I cannot control them. whining for more.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Marlborough will return soon.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 96.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: What is that to me? Your politics is dreary Harley. I have what I want, you have what you want. Our business is done.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: If Marlborough remains head of our forces she has every right to be at court. Even if she is at odds with the Queen.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: I imagined you would. The Queen and her must not have the opportunity to repair this wedge between them. For if they do I pity what Lady Marlborough will make of you. If there was some gentle nudge you might provide to the Queen’s cogitations on this issue. Abigail nods. 138 INT SARAH’S SOUTHAMPTON HOUSE, DAY 138 Sarah sits at her desk, she dips a pen in an ink well, pu it to the paper, but cannot begin. The ink just runs into blob. She casts that sheet of paper aside. Starts again. “You cunt’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And starts again, ‘God I miss you’ And again... ‘I dreamt I stabbed you in the eye’ And again... ‘My dearest Mrs Morley’ She continues writing the letter.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY. 139
dialogues.text: A pile of mail, Anne is on the bed surrounded by rabbits. is, casting aside letters manically with her good hand. Nothing. Abigail has entered and is watching.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 97.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: (TO FOOTMAN 4)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is all the mail?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You seek something?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: No. A...fabric piece from my cousin in Florence.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I’m sure it will come. The footman (4) nods. Abigail signals him to leave. She stands with the privy purse books.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everyone is on the bed. Shall I join?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Of course. She sits. Takes the Queen’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I am in a quandary and you are my dearest one. I do not know whether to speak of...

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I will... I am not sure.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I do not like this, you will lodge this unknowable thing in my brain and it will eat me with horrible possibilities.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It is not horrible dear Anne. It is just money.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Money?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I have found in the books, large amounts of money that seem to have flowed to Marlborough. But is not reflected in the forces receipts of expenses.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 98.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It is gone. I did not know who's attention to bring it to. Shall 1 request it back on his return? Quietly perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You are saying Sarah diverted money to him?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It does seem so. Some seven thousand. Anne looks at her a beat. Utterly certain.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: She would not.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It is just-

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: She would not! Anne stares at her, like she sees through her suddenly. Abigail scrambles.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I am of course, perhaps mistaken in the bookkeeping. Sometimes all these numbers are dizzying. And they often do add up on second or third attempt. They are as fickle as humans. A simple explanation I am not seeing. We shall banish it from our minds. We should take the children for a walk in the garden?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: No. Thank you. I need to rest. Anne lies down stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You may go. Abigail bows, looks at all the torn mail.

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY / RED STAIRS DAY 140
dialogues.text: Abigail exits into a hallway knowing she slipped up.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 99. 141 142 143

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Fuck! OMITTED 14. INT SARAH'S (NOW ABIGAIL’S)QUARTERS DAY 142 Morning. Abigail sits drinking tea. Sally enters she carr a tray of mail. She puts it before her.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I need to put it back. Abigail ignores her. It is all addressed to the Queen. Sh leafs through her mail. See’s Sarah's wax seal on a lette Takes it.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Be gone. Sally takes the rest of the mail and goes. Abigail opens letter. She reads it. Is strangely touched. Wipes a tear away. She tosses it in a nearby fire. INT ANNE’S APARTMENTS DAY 143 Anne frenetically goes through her mail on the bed. Tosse letters away. Abigail watches. Anne summons a Footman (4) leans toward her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: This cannot be all of it!

dialogues.speaker: FOOTMAN
dialogues.text: It is M’aam. She snaps.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Don’t lean at me!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Shall we request another fabric piece from your cousin in Florence? Maybe it was lost or eaten by mice on the long journey.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: No. Just. I would like to know all my mail is here.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 100.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Of course. Footman go and check again. Immediately! Incompetent! He scurries away. Anne settles back.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They are waiting.

dialogues.speaker: INT ANNE'S APARTMENTS DAY. 145
dialogues.text: Anne is propped up in a chair. She holds her stomach, grimaces, a tray of hot chocolate and cake half eaten bes her. Anne is breathing in a labored fashion. The men swim and out of focus. They are in the middle of a cabinet meeting. Harley, Godolphin and a small group of politicia are arguing.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Marlborough is at Southampton. We need a decision.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Your Majesty if I-

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: There was very little mail today. Godolphin takes this in. Harley not sure what is going on

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Quite. If I may, the situation with Marlborough.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: He is stealing from me!

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: What? Your Majesty that is preposterous.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Lady Abigail. The privy purse. Is it not true they have stolen from me? Damaged us? Abigail is stunned. She nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It is all there in black and white. She must be ruined and banished from their beloved England. They are not loyal! They would hurt us, our country, the Queen!  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 101.

dialogues.speaker: GODOLPHIN
dialogues.text: Your Majesty if I may-

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You may not. He will be charged. They will be banished! I have spoken. Get out!

dialogues.speaker: INT SARAH'S SOUTHAMPTON HOUSE DAY 146
dialogues.text: Sarah is drinking tea with Marlborough. She checks out th window, anxiously. A group of armed riders approach the house, a BAILIFF at head of them. She takes this in for a shocked moment.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The mail is here. He looks up at her. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am suddenly so tired of England my darling. Perhaps we should go somewhere else. 147 INT ANNE’S APARTMENTS DAY 147 Anne lies in bed, she opens her eyes. Sees Abigail sittin a chair, reading by the window, dropping a madeleine into mouth. A rabbit wanders near her foot, she lifts a foot and trap the rabbit under her foot. It struggles for a moment. She lets it go with a smile. Anne slides herself out of the bed. Lands on the floor, i pain. Abigail hears a grunt. Sees Anne is on the floor crawling, in pain.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Anne. Abigail rushes to her, takes her under the arms to help h up.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Darling Anne. Let’s get you in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: How dare you touch the Queen like that. Anne leans on the wall.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 102.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I-

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I did not ask you to speak.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My leg. Rub it.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You should lie down.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You will speak when asked to. Abigail gets it, drops to her knees starts rubbing.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am so dizzy...I need to hang on to.. She grabs at Abigail’s hair, wraps a hunk around her fing holding it hard. Abigail winces.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Something... Abigail rubs, looks over at the cage full of rabbits acro the room sitting staring at her. Anne winces in pain stares at the wall. Closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: THE END
